perturbation.original_text: (e) Payment. Upon Customer's acceptance of any order, Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer at least Twenty-Five Percent (25%) of the total order price. Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer the remaining balance upon receipt Packing List and Bill of landing documents, from origin in Brazil Farm.
perturbation.changed_text: (e) Payment. Upon Customer's acceptance of any order, Distributor shall submit to Company via wire transfer at least Twenty-Five Percent (25%) of the total order price. Distributor shall submit to Company via wire transfer the remaining balance within three (3) business days of Customer's acceptance of the order.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict regarding the payment terms. Originally, the final payment was due upon receipt of shipping documents. Now, it's due within three business days of customer acceptance, regardless of document receipt, creating uncertainty about when payment is actually required.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Obligations After Termination. In the event that this Agreement is terminated or expires on its own terms, Company shall have no further responsibilities to Distributor except that in the event the Agreement terminates for any reason other than a breach hereof by Distributor, Company shall be obligated to process orders accepted by Company prior to the effective date of such termination or expiration or within Ninety (90) days thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Obligations After Termination. In the event that this Agreement is terminated or expires on its own terms, Company shall have no further responsibilities to Distributor except that in the event the Agreement terminates for any reason other than a breach hereof by Distributor, Company shall be obligated to process orders accepted by Company prior to the effective date of such termination or expiration or within Thirty (30) days thereafter.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict regarding the timeframe for processing orders after termination. The original text specifies Ninety (90) days, while the modified text shortens this to Thirty (30) days. This creates uncertainty regarding the company's responsibility to process orders after the contract ends.

perturbation.original_text: (i) Notices. Unless otherwise specifically provided herein, all notices, consents, requests, demands and other communications required or permitted hereunder: (i) shall be in writing; (ii)) shall be sent by email, certified or registered U.S. mail, or reliable express delivery service (with a copy sent by one of the foregoing means), charges prepaid as applicable, to the appropriate address(es) or number(s) set forth below; and (iii) shall be deemed to have been given on the date of receipt by the addressee, as evidenced by (A) a receipt executed by the addressee (or a responsible person in his or her office), the records of the Person delivering such communication or a notice to the effect that such addressee refused to claim or accept such communication, if sent by messenger, U.S. mail or express delivery service, or (B) a receipt generated by the sender's email showing that such communication was sent to the appropriate number on a specified date, if sent by email. All such communications shall be sent to the addresses for each Party as first set forth above, or to such other addresses or numbers as any Party may inform the others by giving Seven (7) days prior notice.
perturbation.changed_text: (i) Notices. Unless otherwise specifically provided herein, all notices, consents, requests, demands and other communications required or permitted hereunder: (i) shall be in writing; (ii)) shall be sent by certified or registered U.S. mail, or reliable express delivery service (with a copy sent by one of the foregoing means), charges prepaid as applicable, to the appropriate address(es) or number(s) set forth below; and (iii) shall be deemed to have been given on the date of dispatch by the sender, as evidenced by the records of the Person delivering such communication if sent by messenger, U.S. mail or express delivery service. All such communications shall be sent to the addresses for each Party as first set forth above, or to such other addresses or numbers as any Party may inform the others by giving Fourteen (14) days prior notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction in how notices are to be sent and when they are considered 'given'. Email is removed as an acceptable form. The original text says notice is given on the date of receipt, while the modified text states it's given on the date of dispatch. This introduces ambiguity and potential disputes, specially if there are delays in mail. Moreover, the time for informing the addresses changes from 7 to 14 days, adding to inconsistency.
